page.title: 17HEALTH
page.content: The{Southern General Hospital}has a Neurosurgical Unit where people with head injuries are treated. It not only serves the Glasgow area, but accepts cases from other parts of the country. The hospital also has many other wards which cater for men's, women's, and Children's illnesses. Regular checks are made on the {health}of children at school to examine heads, eyes and general fitness. The children are also immunised against diseases such as Polio, Whooping Cough, German Measles and Smallpox. The{Govan Health Centre}has 5 surgeries, with 25 doctors who treat 28,000 patients. Also in our area, there is {Shieldhall Sewage Works.} Here the city's sewage is purified and returned to the waters of the River Clyde.
